00025 #ifndef _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00026 #define _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_

00028 #include <oxt/tracable_exception.hpp>
00029 #include <string>
00030 #include <sstream>
00031 #include <cstring>

00033 /**
00034  * @defgroup Exceptions Exceptions

00037 namespace Passenger {

00039 using namespace std;
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * Represents an error returned by a system call or a standard library call.
00043  *
00044  * Use the code() method to find out the value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time
00045  * the error occured.
00046  *
00047  * @ingroup Exceptions
00048  */
00049 class SystemException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00050 private:
00051         string briefMessage;
00052         string systemMessage;
00053         string fullMessage;
00054         int m_code;
00055 public:
00056         /**
00057          * Create a new SystemException.
00058          *
00059          * @param briefMessage A brief message describing the error.
00060          * @param errorCode The error code, i.e. the value of errno right after the error occured.
00061          * @note A system description of the error will be appended to the given message.
00062          *    For example, if <tt>errorCode</tt> is <tt>EBADF</tt>, and <tt>briefMessage</tt>
00063          *    is <em>"Something happened"</em>, then what() will return <em>"Something happened: Bad
00064          *    file descriptor (10)"</em> (if 10 is the number for EBADF).
00065          * @post code() == errorCode
00066          * @post brief() == briefMessage
00067          */
00068         SystemException(const string &briefMessage, int errorCode) {
00069                 stringstream str;
00070                 
00071                 str << strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")";
00072                 systemMessage = str.str();
00073                 
00074                 setBriefMessage(briefMessage);
00075                 m_code = errorCode;
00076         }
00077         
00078         virtual ~SystemException() throw() {}
00079         
00080         virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00081                 return fullMessage.c_str();
00082         }
00083         
00084         void setBriefMessage(const string &message) {
00085                 briefMessage = message;
00086                 fullMessage = briefMessage + ": " + systemMessage;
00087         }
00088         
00089         /**
00090          * The value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time the error occured.
00091          */
00092         int code() const throw() {
00093                 return m_code;
00094         }
00095         
00096         /**
00097          * Returns a brief version of the exception message. This message does
00098          * not include the system error description, and is equivalent to the
00099          * value of the <tt>message</tt> parameter as passed to the constructor.
00100          */
00101         string brief() const throw() {
00102                 return briefMessage;
00103         }
00104         
00105         /**
00106          * Returns the system's error message. This message contains both the
00107          * content of <tt>strerror(errno)</tt> and the errno number itself.
00108          */
00109         string sys() const throw() {
00110                 return systemMessage;
00111         }
00112 };
00113 
00114 /**
00115  * A filesystem error, as returned by the operating system. This may include,
00116  * for example, permission errors.
00117  *
00118  * @ingroup Exceptions
00119  */
00120 class FileSystemException: public SystemException {
00121 private:
00122         string m_filename;
00123 public:
00124         FileSystemException(const string &message, int errorCode,
00125                 const string &filename)
00126                 : SystemException(message, errorCode),
00127                   m_filename(filename) {}
00128         
00129         virtual ~FileSystemException() throw() {}
00130         
00131         /**
00132          * The filename that's associated to the error.
00133          */
00134         string filename() const throw() {
00135                 return m_filename;
00136         }
00137 };
00138 
00139 /**
00140  * Unable to retrieve the system time using <tt>time()</tt>.
00141  *
00142  * @ingroup Exceptions
00143  */
00144 class TimeRetrievalException: public SystemException {
00145 public:
00146         TimeRetrievalException(const string &message, int errorCode)
00147                 : SystemException(message, errorCode)
00148                 {}
00149         virtual ~TimeRetrievalException() throw() {}
00150 };

00152 /**
00153  * Represents an error that occured during an I/O operation.
00154  *
00155  * @ingroup Exceptions
00156  */
00157 class IOException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00158 private:
00159         string msg;
00160 public:
00161         IOException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00162         virtual ~IOException() throw() {}
00163         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00164 };

00198 /**
00199  * Thrown when SpawnManager or ApplicationPool fails to spawn an application
00200  * instance. The exception may contain an error page, which is a user-friendly
00201  * HTML page with details about the error.
00202  */
00203 class SpawnException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00204 private:
00205         string msg;
00206         bool m_hasErrorPage;
00207         bool m_isHTML;
00208         string m_errorPage;
00209 public:
00210         SpawnException(const string &message)
00211                 : msg(message) {
00212                 m_hasErrorPage = false;
00213                 m_isHTML = false;
00214         }
00215         
00216         SpawnException(const string &message, const string &errorPage, bool isHTML = true)
00217                 : msg(message), m_errorPage(errorPage)
00218         {
00219                 m_hasErrorPage = true;
00220                 m_isHTML = isHTML;
00221         }
00222         
00223         virtual ~SpawnException() throw() {}
00224         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00225         
00226         /**
00227          * Check whether an error page is available.
00228          */
00229         bool hasErrorPage() const {
00230                 return m_hasErrorPage;
00231         }
00232         
00233         /**
00234          * Return the error page content.
00235          *
00236          * @pre hasErrorPage()
00237          */
00238         const string getErrorPage() const {
00239                 return m_errorPage;
00240         }
00241         
00242         /**
00243          * Whether the error page content is HTML.
00244          *
00245          * @pre hasErrorPage()
00246          */
00247         bool isHTML() const {
00248                 return m_isHTML;
00249         }
00250 };
